lines.text: That's what you've done with your force field. You've compressed the energy of years into a moment.
But... that's like... the fourth dimension.
I don't believe it. I'm a cop. I work with facts. Now I have to start looking for something that saps the life out of a man like juice out of an orange.
Nothing can stop him. Can't imprison him or surround him with men or guns or tanks. No walls thick enough or guns strong enough. A man in the fourth dimension is indestructible.
I'm psychic.

[to Tony]
Is this why I sent you to school? To become a mystic?
Two objects *can* occupy the same space, under the right conditions.
Cargonite, huh? As in Carson.
Anything developed in this lab is likely to have his name on it.
Then you believe it can be done?
Believe it? I've done it!
Scott, there may be side effects of this we don't know anything about.
I keep thinking there must be some connection between force fields and Cargonite.
Scott! How did you get in here?
Through the door.
[after walking through it without opening it]

[to Tony]
You're trying to tell me your brother can get energy time from other people?
From now on, I do the taking.
Tell them, shoot to kill. This guy's a wild one.
Look, he's not a magician. He's not invisible. He can't fly.
